hero.title: Escape to Nature
hero.subtitle: 100% self-sufficient finca in the heart of Tarragona. Peace, disconnection, and sustainability.

about.intro: Finca Emmita is 10 mins drive from El Perelló and 20 mins from the sea, we are in the middle of a valley, with no neighbours or roads nearby. All you can hear is the sound of silence. The finca is 100% self-sufficient. It is solar powered, we collect rain water and the grey water is recycled to water the vegetable garden and plants. We offer also high speed internet.
about.highlight: IF YOU ARE LOOKING FOR PEACE, QUIET, DISCONNECTION AND ENJOYING MOTHER NATURE, this is the place.
about.elPerello: The nearest village is El Perelló, a small town which sits back 5 kilometres from the sea. Because of this it has not been developed as a tourist resort, and maintains a rustic charm. It is only a small town, but has all the facilities, cafe bars, restaurants, shops of all sorts, a small super-market, banks, a laundrette, a pharmacy, and a tourist office. There are internet facilities, and international newspapers are available at the newsagents. On Saturday morning there is a local market. El Perelló is also famous for its local honey and oil.

laCasita.title: La Casita
laCasita.shortDescription: Wooden house with well-equipped kitchen, bedroom, living room with sofa and private terrace.
laCasita.longDescription: La Casita is a newly built wooden house offering a main room with a well-equipped small kitchen, dining area, sofa, pellet stove and a separate double bedroom. The bathroom has a large shower. There is a nice terrace with a table, chairs and sunloungers.

laOlivita.title: La Olivita
laOlivita.shortDescription: Stone house with mezzanine sleeping loft, wood burner, and terrace with BBQ.
laOlivita.longDescription: La Olivita is a traditional country house offering a well-equipped small kitchen, a living room with a sofa and wood burner, the mezzanine has a double bed and is accessible by stairs. The bathroom has a large shower. There is a nice terrace with a table and chairs, sunloungers and BBQ (not used from June to September due to fire risks and it is replaced by a plancha)

casaLuna.title: Casa Luna
casaLuna.shortDescription: Wooden house with 2 en-suite bedrooms, cozy porch and wood stove.
casaLuna.longDescription: Casa Luna is a wooden house, built 20 years ago, completely self-sufficient with solar energy and rainwater collection. With 2 en-suite bedrooms, it can accommodate up to 4 guests. Enjoy the outdoor terrace with table, sofa and sunloungers.

testimonials.title: What Our Guests Say
testimonials.subtitle: Hear from people who experienced the peace and beauty of Finca Emmita

items.author: Sarah & James
items.content: Our stay at La Casita was absolutely magical. The peace and quiet was exactly what we needed. Waking up to birdsong and no traffic noise was incredible. Emma is a wonderful host who made us feel so welcome. The self-sufficiency of the finca is impressive - solar power, rainwater collection - it felt good to stay somewhere so eco-friendly.

items.author: Marie
items.content: Perfect spot for a digital detox! La Olivita is charming and cozy. The wood burner kept us warm in the evenings. We spent our days hiking in the valley and our nights stargazing - no light pollution at all! Emma gave us great recommendations for local spots. Will definitely come back.

items.author: Tom & Lisa
items.content: What a unique experience! Being completely off-grid but still having all the comforts was amazing. The kids loved exploring the land and we loved the peace. High-speed internet meant I could still work remotely for a few hours. Emma is incredibly knowledgeable about sustainable living.

items.author: Carlos
items.content: An incredible place to disconnect. The finca is in the middle of a beautiful valley, with no neighbors in sight. Emma is very attentive and makes you feel at home. La Casita has everything you need and more. We will definitely be back.

items.author: Anna & Peter
items.content: We were looking for somewhere truly peaceful and Finca Emmita exceeded our expectations. The sound of nothing is beautiful! La Olivita is beautifully renovated and the composting toilet is actually really nice. Emma's passion for sustainability is inspiring.

items.author: Julia
items.content: Best vacation rental we've ever had. The location is stunning - mountains, valleys, and just 20 minutes from the sea. Emma is the perfect host - helpful but gives you privacy. The solar setup is impressive and worked perfectly even on cloudy days.

host.title: Meet Emma
host.subtitle: Passionate about sustainable living & nature
host.bio1: Hello! I'm Emma, and I've been living at Finca Emmita since 2018. After years in the city, I decided to create a space where people could truly disconnect and reconnect with nature.
host.bio2: What started as a personal dream became a reality when I transformed this finca into a 100% self-sufficient one, from solar panels to rainwater harvesting.
host.bio3: I love sharing this peaceful paradise with guests who appreciate the beauty of simplicity, the sound of silence, and the magic of starlit nights without light pollution. Whether you need recommendations for local hiking trails or tips for sustainable living, I'm always happy to help!
host.sustainabilityDesc: Living in harmony with nature and the environment
host.hospitalityDesc: Making every guest feel at home
host.typicallyResponds: Typically responds within a few hours
